preview.sampleIntro: In today's competitive business landscape, understanding your topic has become essential for professionals. This comprehensive approach will help you implement effective strategies that drive measurable results.
preview.sampleSectionDesc: This section will dive deeper into the specific aspects of {{keywordText}}, providing actionable insights and practical examples that {{audience}} can implement immediately in their {{industry}}.
preview.sampleCtaDesc: Ready to implement these {{keywordText}} strategies? Start with the first recommendation and track your progress.
preview.tonePreviewDesc: Your content will be written in a {{contentTone}} tone, {{toneExplanation}}

toneExplanation.professional: maintaining a formal, business-appropriate style with industry expertise.
toneExplanation.casual: using relaxed, conversational language like talking to a friend over coffee.
toneExplanation.authoritative: demonstrating strong leadership voice with confidence and credibility through research-backed statements.
toneExplanation.friendly: creating a warm, welcoming atmosphere that builds connection with readers.
toneExplanation.conversational: engaging readers as if you're speaking directly to them in a natural dialogue.
toneExplanation.educational: focusing on clear instruction and knowledge transfer with systematic explanations.
toneExplanation.informative: providing objective, balanced information in an encyclopedic style perfect for factual content.
toneExplanation.inspirational: motivating and uplifting readers with encouraging language ideal for coaching and wellness content.
toneExplanation.humorous: incorporating light wit and humor to make content engaging and entertaining.
toneExplanation.empathetic: using warm, understanding language perfect for sensitive topics like health and mental wellness.

guide.title: Smart Structure Selection Guide
guide.seoText: How-To and FAQ formats typically rank highest in search results. Tutorial content with step-by-step instructions receives more engagement and better SERP features.
guide.structureText: Each format shows its content flow for easy visualization. The difficulty rating helps you choose based on your writing experience and time constraints.
guide.bestPracticesText: Use comparison structures for decision-making content, case studies for showcasing results, and FAQ formats for addressing common user questions.

recommendation.title: Recommendation for
recommendation.guide: How-To/Step-by-Step structure works best for guides - high SEO value and user engagement.
recommendation.blogArticle: Intro + 3 Main Points or Problem‚ÜíSolution structures are ideal for blog articles.
recommendation.caseStudy: Case Study structure is perfect - tells a complete story from challenge to results.
recommendation.newsletter: Story + Facts + Lessons keeps newsletter readers engaged with narrative flow.
recommendation.default: Choose based on your goal: How-To for tutorials, FAQ for SEO, Comparison for decision-making content.

qualityIndicator.title: Content Quality Score
qualityIndicator.description: Real-time analysis of your content setup

tips.addActionWords: Consider adding action words like "How to", "Ultimate Guide", or "Best Ways".
tips.addNumbers: Consider adding specific numbers (e.g., "5 Ways", "10 Tips").
tips.addPowerWords: Consider adding power words like "Ultimate", "Essential", or "Proven".
tips.addSpecificBenefit: Include specific benefits (increase, improve, save, etc.).
tips.topicTooShort: Topic is too short. Aim for at least 10 characters.
tips.topicTooLong: Topic is too long. Keep it under 120 characters.
tips.addMoreDescriptive: Add more descriptive words for clarity.
tips.addMoreKeywords: Add more keywords. Aim for 3-7 keywords.
tips.addMoreLongTail: Add more long-tail keywords (3+ words) for better targeting.
tips.makeMoreConcise: Consider making the topic more concise.
tips.reduceKeywords: Consider reducing keywords. 3-7 is optimal for focus.
tips.titleTooShort: Title is too short for SEO. Aim for 50-60 characters.
tips.titleTooLong: Title may be truncated in search results. Keep under 60 characters.
tips.keywordsTooShort: Keywords are too short. Use more specific phrases.
tips.keywordsTooLong: Keywords might be too long. Aim for 2-4 words each.
tips.increaseKeywordDiversity: Increase keyword diversity to cover more search terms.
tips.addAtLeastThree: Add at least 3 keywords for SEO optimization.
tips.enterToSee: Enter a {{type}} to see quality assessment

0.title: Define Topic & Target Audience
tips: Be specific about your topic - avoid broad, generic subjects
Clearly define your target audience demographics and interests
Consider your audience's pain points and what value you can provide

learnMoreSections.title: Topic Definition Best Practices
learnMoreSections.content: A well-defined topic guides the entire content creation process. It should be clear, specific, and aligned with your audience's interests.

good: How to Style Wide-Leg Jeans for Different Body Types

learnMoreSections.title: Defining Your Target Audience
learnMoreSections.content: Understanding your audience is crucial for creating content that resonates. Consider their age, interests, challenges, and preferred communication style.

good: Tech-savvy millennials interested in productivity apps
Small business owners struggling with social media marketing
Fitness enthusiasts looking for home workout routines

videos.title: How to Choose Winning Content Topics

1.title: Upload Media & Visual Content
tips: Upload high-quality images (min 800x600px) for better content suggestions
Choose images that directly relate to your topic
Enable image suggestions to enhance your content with relevant visuals

learnMoreSections.title: Choosing the Right Images
learnMoreSections.content: Images should be relevant, high-quality, and properly sized. They help our AI understand your content context and generate more accurate suggestions.

bad: Stock photos unrelated to your topic
Images with watermarks or copyright issues

learnMoreSections.title: Visual Content Strategy
learnMoreSections.content: Visual elements enhance engagement and comprehension. They should support your content narrative and provide additional value.

2.title: SEO Keywords & Title Optimization
tips: Include your primary keyword in the title naturally
Use long-tail keywords for better targeting
Keep titles under 60 characters for SEO

learnMoreSections.title: Keyword Research Fundamentals
learnMoreSections.content: Effective keywords balance search volume with competition. Focus on terms your audience actually searches for.

good: how to meal prep for weight loss
beginner yoga poses for back pain

learnMoreSections.title: SEO Title Optimization
learnMoreSections.content: Great titles are compelling to humans while being optimized for search engines. They should clearly indicate what value the content provides.

good: 7 Proven Email Subject Lines That Boost Open Rates
Complete Guide to Remote Work Productivity in 2024
Why Your Content Marketing Isn't Working (And How to Fix It)

3.title: Content Structure & Tone
tips: Match your tone to your audience and brand personality
Use clear section headings for better readability
Include a strong call-to-action that aligns with your goals

learnMoreSections.title: Content Structure Types
learnMoreSections.content: Different content types work better for different goals. Choose a structure that serves your content purpose.

bad: No clear beginning, middle, or end

learnMoreSections.title: Tone & Voice Guidelines
learnMoreSections.content: Your content tone should reflect your brand personality while being appropriate for your audience and topic.

good: Professional but approachable for B2B content
Casual and encouraging for fitness content
Authoritative but accessible for educational content

4.title: Generation Settings
tips: Enable plagiarism checking for professional content
Choose output format based on your publishing platform

learnMoreSections.title: Word Count Optimization
learnMoreSections.content: Content length should match your topic depth and audience expectations. Longer isn't always better.

bad: Padding content just to hit word count

learnMoreSections.title: Format Selection Guide
learnMoreSections.content: Choose the output format that best fits your publishing workflow and platform requirements.

5.title: Review & Generate
tips: Review all sections for completeness before generating
Higher SEO scores typically lead to better content performance
Use Quick Edit to make final adjustments

learnMoreSections.title: Pre-Generation Checklist
learnMoreSections.content: A final review ensures your content will meet your goals and audience needs.

learnMoreSections.title: Understanding SEO Scores
learnMoreSections.content: Our SEO scoring considers multiple factors including keyword usage, content structure, and readability.

bad: Low scores often mean missing keywords
